column4: Im having trouble updating to ubuntu 9.04 via CD, i get the errors 'Failed to fetch cdrom:[Ubuntu 9.04 _Jaunty Jackalope_ - Release i386 (20090420.1)]/pool/restricted/l/linux-restricted-modules/linux-restricted-modules-common_2.6.28-11.15_all.deb Hash Sum mismatch

Failed to fetch cdrom:[Ubuntu 9.04 _Jaunty Jackalope_ - Release i386 (20090420.1)]/pool/restricted/l/linux-restricted-modules/linux-restricted-modules-2.6.28-11-generic_2.6.28-11.15_i386.deb Hash Sum mismatch'
how exactly are you trying to upgrade?
when you put the alt cd in it comes up with the option to upgrade
is the apt repo set to upgrade from cd?
yes, 9.04, and im checking repo now
just added the cd, strying upgrade now
are you trying to upgrade from 8.10 to 9.04?
i think this method is for upgrading packages and not the system itself
cant you use boot from cd option to boot?
well i chose the update thing in the task tray to try first, and right now itrs doing a 'partial' disto upgrade
would that upgrade and keep my current files?
now it came up with a, quite extensive, list of updates it couldnt download
